verb.description: Bind or compel (someone), especially legally or morally.
examples: the medical establishment is obligated to take action in the best interest of the public
the money must be obligated within 30 days

adjective.description: Restricted to a particular function or mode of life.

origin: Late Middle English (as an adjective in the sense bound by law): from Latin obligatus, past participle of obligare (see oblige). The current adjectival use dates from the late 19th century.
